position.marginalia_text: (6) King Queen Laertes a Flourish one with a cup of wine

substitution.copyText: Hora. I knew you must be edified by the margin e're you had done.
Court. The carriages Sir are the hangers.
substitution.amendedText: Ost. The carriages Sir are the hangers.

substitution.copyText: Ham. The phrase would be more german to the matter if we could carry a cannon by our sides, I would it might be hangers till then: but on, six Barbary horses against six French swords, their assigns, and three liberal conceited carriages, that's the French bet against the Danish, why is this all that you call it?
substitution.amendedText: Ham. The phrase would be more germane to the matter, if we could carry a cannon by our sides, but on; six Barbary horses, against six French swords, their assigns, and three liberal conceited carriages; that's the French bet against the Danish; as I take it.

substitution.copyText: Ham. How if I answer no?
substitution.amendedText: Ham. How if I answer, no?

substitution.copyText: Ham. Sir I will walk here in the Hall, if it please his Majesty, it is the breathing time of day with me, let the foils be brought, the Gentleman willing, and the King hold his purpose, I will win for him if I can; if not, I will gain nothing but my shame and the odd hits.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Sir, I will walk here in the Hall, if it please his Majesty, it is the breathing time of day with me; let the foils be brought, the Gentleman willing, and the King hold his purpose, I will win for him if I can: if not, I will gain nothing but my shame and the odd hits.

substitution.copyText: Ham. To this effect Sir, after what flourish your nature will.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. To this effect, Sir, after what flourish your nature will.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Yours does well to commend it self, there are no tongues else for his turn. | Hora. This lapwing runs away with the shell on his head. | Ham. " He did so Sir with his dug before he suckt it; " thus has he and many more of the same breed that I know, the drossie age dotes on, only got the tune of the time, and out of an habit of inconnter, a kind of misty collection, which carries them through and through the most profane and renowed opinions; and do but blow them to their trial, the bubbles are out.
